title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 14-3.21 - Derating of a boiler

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 14-3.21 - Derating of a boiler

State Regulations
(a) General requirements. Derating of a boiler by decreasing the maximum allowable
working pressure may be done only after the requirements of subdivisions (b)
through (d) of this section have been met. Derating may be initiated by the
owner or the inspector. (b) Nameplate requirements. When a boiler is derated, an additional nameplate shall
be permanently attached. The nameplate for derating shall be as follows: Image
(c) Nameplate attachment. Attachment of the
nameplate shall be witnessed by the inspector. (d) Reports. The inspector shall report the
derating to the department. Notes
